# Online resources

[SMC and epidemic renewal models](https://nicsteyn2.github.io/SMCforRt/): an online "book" demonstrating sequential Monte Carlo methods for fitting epidemic renewal models. Accompanies *A primer on inference and prediction with epidemic renewal models using sequential Monte Carlo methods*.

[Rt estimators in Julia](https://nicsteyn2.github.io/RobustRtEstimators/): short vignettes accompanying the code provided in the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/nicsteyn2/RobustRtEstimators) for *Robust uncertainty quantification in popular estimators of the instantaneous reproduction number*. Provides Julia implementation of EpiEstim and EpiFilter, as well as the corresponding parameter fitting methodology developed in the paper.

[Pandemic-risk-related behavioural data portal](https://m-whit-ic.shinyapps.io/react-social-shiny/): an R shiny server hosting a large quantity of aggregated data on pandemic-risk-related behaviours in England, collected as part of the REACT-1 study. By making these data publicly available, we hope to enable further research. Methodology can be found in our [preprint](https://doi.org/10.1101/2025.03.03.25323250).
